website_summaries.verdict: A unique model that offers an alternative to traditional post designs – but it lacks the durability of our Best of the Best pick.
pros: Sports an award-winning triangular design that provides multiple scratching surfaces for your cat
Comes with catnip and a 6-month warranty
cons: It's the most expensive model we tested, and it has the tendency to shed pieces of cardboard after cats have used it over a period of time

customer_reviews.title: Four paws up for this scratcher!
customer_reviews.text: The is the most popular scratcher in the house with my Chaos Crew. They perch on the top edge, they scratch on the side, they run through the middle, and they scratch in the middle rolling around like a mechanic trying to access something under a car.
customer_reviews.author: B. White

customer_reviews.title: I have one very happy cat since this arrived!
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats was thrilled when this arrived and seems to love it as you can see from the photos. He enjoys horizontal scratching on the inside bottom as well as sitting it in and playing around it. Nice modern look. I didn't give it 5 stars since my other cat who enjoys vertical scratching on my furniture has not yet been attracted to it, and this was the main reason I made the purchase. Maybe he will in time. I am noticing a fair amount of cardboard flakes coming off as it is being scratched which can easily be swept up but wondering how long the product will last with this occurring.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Super satisfied with this product 💖
customer_reviews.text: My kitten loves this scratcher he wears himself out all day while I'm at work and behaves himself for the most part . I added some laces and stuff for him to play with . Super satisfied with this product 💖
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats favorite scratcher
customer_reviews.text: It took them awhile to take to this scratcher, but now its their favorite one in the house. As a bonus with all of PetFusions scratchers, theres plenty of material on the inside for the cats to scratch. Once theyre all used up on the outside, you can cut them with a saw and use the other side. My cats also like to lay inside of this one.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: I knew this would be perfect for our cat
customer_reviews.text: I knew this would be perfect for our cat, Wednesday. As soon as I pulled it out of the box, she hopped in/on it right away, and was in scratching heaven. It's the perfect size for her, too (almost two years old, she weighs about nine lbs). She'll either sit and scratch, or lie inside and take a nap. This is the second or third product we've gotten from PetFusion (we have an extra-large food mat for our mastiff), and I have been very pleased with their products.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Craig

customer_reviews.title: Useless but attractive
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would work but my cats could care less. They won’t even play with it. I tried the catnip trick, but they just ate the catnip and scratched at the carpet under this thing. Sheesh. I bought many of this type of scratcher and they just won’t use this material as a scratching place. Better off with the traditional sisal stuff or the rope covered towers. Expensive experiment.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia (Ginny) Rogers

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it
customer_reviews.text: This is the second piece of furniture purchased from Pet Fusion both equally loved by my cats. The furniture has been quality construction not shredded leaving pieces to clean. The compressed cardboard keeps providing a source of entertainment long after others shred leaving trash to pickup. My first purchase lasted two years keeping four cats claws away from household chairs. This 3-sided post was in the house less than a 30 seconds when the first cat put her claws into the middle. Within seconds the other three followed on the outsides leaving new holes without shred. When this post wears in a few years I won't hesitate to purchase another from Pet Fusion.
customer_reviews.author: Raven4464

customer_reviews.title: Best scratcher I ever had
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES it! He uses it a lot as a scratch post, he also plays with it, and he even sleeps inside it... Best scratcher I ever had. Update of my review: actually, even the cat of my neighbors comes in my apartment and uses the scratcher... big success!!
customer_reviews.author: Elodie

customer_reviews.title: Very good scratcher
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple cats who, if given no other option, will scratch the furniture and walls. They are cats and this base insinct comes with the joy of sharing my home with them. We have tried sisal and carpeted scratchers because of their affordability, but they get stuck on them and we have to save them from being stuck. I felt this was a bit expensive but the value is certainly there. It is solid, the cats love it, they don't get stuck and compared to other corrugated scratchers, it is not as messy since the carboard is very compact. I will definitely buy another once this has work out.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Linsenbach

customer_reviews.title: Most excellent (and excellently priced) cat scratcher
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! The price is right, and my two cats took to this right away. I've previously had big, multi-level cat trees for them but I now live in an apartment that's too small to fit one of those. I wasn't sure this would cut it, but it seems to be a worthy alternative. They always try to scratch any cardboard that comes through the apartment, so I figured they would like this and I was right. The only downside is that it kind of has a weird, chemical-y smell when you first take it out of the plastic, but it goes away pretty fast. Both me and my couch are thankful for this scratcher!
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this...and it saved my sofa!
customer_reviews.text: My kitten loves this cardboard scratcher. After putting a little bit of catnip on it and hiding a few treats in the crevaces, my cat took right too it. She plays on it, climbs it, and scratches the heck out of it. The grooves are handy because some of her fuzzy toys stick to the cardboard surface (kinda like velcro) and she enjoys swatting them off the pillar. The grooves are also handy because they make little pockets for hiding cat treats. I randomly leave treats for her near the top. My cat never knows when a treat might appear on her scratcher, so she checks often...a good thing! She now scratches this instead of the nearby sofa.
customer_reviews.author: M. Santos

customer_reviews.title: love scratching it
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's an excellent product. After all, my cats love it. In my own opinion, it's not one of the best of PetFusion's wonderful products. After I set it up, my cats let it stand there for about a week. I was kinda worried. After that, they use it frequently. It is mainly made of paper and cardboard. So, be aware that the scratched-off pieces can be everywhere. I wish it could be more stable. When my cats were using it, sometimes it wobbled. Also, it might be a little small for bigger cats. It seems a bit small for my 12-pound one.
customer_reviews.author: Boyang Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, strong product
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful, strong product. Perfect for cats who like to scratch in an upright position. My kitten loves this. He happens to be in the same position as the cat in this picure. Do not hesitate to buy this.It will last and last as it has three sides. Really well made.
customer_reviews.author: frannyb

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love it
customer_reviews.text: Both our cats really like this scratching post. Before we bought it, our cats each had their preferred scratching post and they would never both use the same one (I think it had something to do with being territorial). But our cats both like this one so much that they have learned to share. They really like scratching the diagonal side but they also enjoyed exploring the inner portion when we first got it. It's also convenient because it's heavy enough to balance out its own weight while they are scratching it, which is better than a lot of vertical posts I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Donahue

customer_reviews.title: Modern day cat scratcher
customer_reviews.text: We now own three PetFusion cat scratchers and love them all! The scratchers are nicely built, modern in design, and the cat uses them. There are those times when I catch the cat acting up and deliberately scratches a piece of furniture. As with any good parent you manage the situation and start the training process from the start by redirecting the cat to the scratcher and providing the needed praises, "good girl!"
customer_reviews.author: Pippa

customer_reviews.title: Only PetFusion for Our House...
customer_reviews.text: PetFusion makes the best cat scratchers and they are super high quality. Totally worth the price. The ones pictured are about 3 years old. I just purchased an additional 3 sided one for another part of my home and have no need to dispose of the one in the pictures. Highly recommend. If you have a cat that enjoys stretching and vertical scratching, get the large 3 sided vertical scratcher, not the standard size. In the picture you are looking at the large 3 sided vertical triangle style and by the glass panels is the infinity style with a rather large cat on it. Both are Petfusion. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Chuck loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: My kitty, Chuck, loves this. He scratches on it multiple times a day. He lays inside, scratches inside, and plays with his toys in and on it. Chuck is 9 lbs, and can walk thru it no problem. I was worried it might be too small for him. But the medium size is perfect for him. It's plenty stable for him to scratch on without it moving. So far, he's scratched up one side pretty good, but it's still got plenty to go before I need to flip it. I think this will last a long while. Chuck loves it, and that makes me super happy!
customer_reviews.author: lori j

customer_reviews.title: My couch is finally safe!
customer_reviews.text: 2/3 or our cats are enamored with this scratcher. All the other scratchers suddenly sit unused - including our couches! I could not be more pleased! I purchased large and our 10lb cat can stretch out his full length. That 1/3 cat? She only scratches on carpeted poles. The cats also love this as a toy. They run around, dart through, hunt from behind, balance on the top, and lay in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: smerline

customer_reviews.title: my 2 cats are not using
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as well as the "rubber band" shaped scratcher - both are really well made and look nice, but unfortunately neither of my two cats are using either, which is why the overall rating is a 3...I did put the catnip on each of the scratching devices - one cat rubbed allover the catnip but does not scratch...she does like to sleep on the long one though - they didn't need another sleeping spot ;-) I have resorted to covering my newer chair with a sheet in hope of getting my one scratcher to "forget about it". Both seem like great products, just wish my cats would use vs. my furniture!
customer_reviews.author: Trl

customer_reviews.title: Great 3-sided one!
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that when one side becomes "old" it can be turned to another of its three sides. My cat took a few days to decide it was something for her, but now likes to use it. I got it when I bought a new chair, getting rid of the one with all the scratching. I didn't want the same thing to happen, so I found this on Amazon. My only complaint, but a small one, is that it sheds bits of the scratcher on the floor, but that is no big problem. My real problem was solved when I got this!
customer_reviews.author: anne elizabeth nixon

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, but my cat needs more of a straight upward scratch
customer_reviews.text: This brand is very high quality. I have previously purchased two ‘Infinity’ style scratching post from this company. My cats love those. This one is a triangle shape and I thought it would be good for my one cat that likes to scratch vertical. The problem with this high quality product, is it is neither straight up and down, nor horizontal. The triangle is somewhat shooshed sides, and neither cat likes it. I have kept the product hoping that my cat that likes to stretch upwards, will fall in love with the swooshed, slanted triangle shape.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: My cats went right for it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scratching post about eight months ago for two kittens. From the moment I put it on the floor they were using it. The first thing they do every morning is use this scratch post. What has really impressed me is that they don't use the furniture or drapes. The scratch board is made out of corrugated cardboard and it's starting to shred although I'm sure it still has a lot of life left. I just find myself vacuuming around it daily. No big deal. When it wears out I’ll definitely buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Ira

customer_reviews.title: Nice Idea but...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a hit with our two cats. Sadly neither of them wants to even go near it. When I first put it out they both inspected it but showed no interest in using it. I have tried enticing them with their wand toys, but they are reluctant to even touch this thing. It's not stable on the hard floor, so I put the little rubber tabs on the bottom, which makes it much more stable, not sliding around. I will give it another week to see if they change their minds. If not, it will be a donation item.
customer_reviews.author: Karen J. Moirao

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SCRATCHER!!!
customer_reviews.text: My big 14 pound 6 month old kitten is a monster when it comes to toys and scratchers are something he hasn't connected with ----- UNTIL THIS ONE. He immediately picked up on it, loved the part he can crawl into, and started scratching it in less than a minute. Because of his large size (ever growing Maine Coon), he gets lazy and prefers semi reclining while scratching (the sofa). Standard upright scratchers are too much effort for him. But this, with the semi-reclining position, if fits him perfectly. Of course, he loved the big box it came in more. Grins.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Acha

customer_reviews.title: Took a little while but he found it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this scratcher at the same time as PetFusion's "Ultimate cat scratcher lounge" (the nifty figure-8 scratcher). Our foster cat found the Ultimate lounge immediately and really went to work on it. He didn't pay much attention to this scratcher for a while. But, two weeks later, the 3-sided scratcher is his "casual" scratcher. He will walk by, arch his back, and take a few digs, then keep going. He still uses the Ultimate as his "really want to dig hard" scratcher but is enjoying the 3-sided, too. Happy cat, happy caretakers, (happy couch and carpets, which he no longer digs at!). Highly recommended scratcher.
customer_reviews.author: David Poole

customer_reviews.title: Awesome scratching thingy mabobber
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something that my two Siamese cats could use (other than my recliner that turned into theirs). This cat scratching triangle thingy mabobber works perfect. They will both be scratching on it from each side at the same time sometimes. Well worth it and I will purchase again once this one gets its full use.
customer_reviews.author: caleb

customer_reviews.title: Sigh. Expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Lord I hate coughing up $$$ for these every couple of months, but the cat sure likes them. She is a large and strong cat who scratches hard and is picky about surfaces - she likes trim and furniture (much to my chagrin), things that don't move, but also won't touch sisal scratchers. I've tried other cardboard scratchers, but they just shift around too much. The triangle shape of this one makes it incredibly stable, and it's dense and holds up relatively well. You also get three "sides", so you can rotate it as it wears down.I'm about to order my fourth one, so they're worth it, at least!
customer_reviews.author: Dissolver

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We got a kitten this week that we were told loves cardboard scratchers. We got this to put next to our leather couch in hopes of minimizing any damage. The kitten loves it! She likes walking through the center and climbing it. She's 10 weeks old so she also uses it as a ladder to climb up to the couch with us. She started scratching it her second day with us and attacks it multiple times a day. Its attractive enough for the living room and makes for some cute pics. It seems like it will last a while but I will definitely reorder!
customer_reviews.author: CaitlynA

customer_reviews.title: Happy family, happy cat!
customer_reviews.text: It was hard to pay the price for this, not knowing if our newly adopted 6 year-old cat would use it. She uses it every day, and there has been zero damage to our house! Excellent purchase! We sprinkle catnip on it occasionally, and we are the proud parents of a beautiful, perfect, happy cat.
customer_reviews.author: Karers

customer_reviews.title: Finally finally finally
customer_reviews.text: Finally, we have a scratching product that our cat will use. We’ve tried many different products including the tall posts, cat condo versions, backs of rugs but she kept going to the couch to scratch. We put double sided tape and pillows to block her but she thought they were toys. She uses this post all the time. The angle of the sides is a big deal. Added cat nip and she’s by it all the time. She is rewarded when we see her scratch it so now our couches are safe again!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: So be happy with this purchase, my cat uses daily
customer_reviews.text: After a couple weeks I can now say this is one of my favorite purchases for my cat! I bought the smaller one and instantly thought the bigger would have been better. But now I am happy I got the small as it fits better and my cat uses this all the time! It doesn't 100% keep hi. From scratching the couch but it has helped! The angle and sturdiness of it makes him love scratching it! It will probably last 6 months at this rate, and I think that's a great value!
customer_reviews.author: M. Matthieu

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves The PetFusion Scratchers!
customer_reviews.text: They don't budge, not a wobble, and don't tip over. They also last a bit longer against claws than other brands. I've brought home other scratchers, but my cat will flat out ignore them and head straight to the PetFusion ones. He has the 3 sided one and the one shaped like a big 8, and he loves them both. It's nice they come with a little baggie of catnip. Sprinkling a bit of those into the corrugated cardboard helps my cat warm up to a new piece of kitty furniture.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieG

customer_reviews.title: Our Leo scratches this post every day
customer_reviews.text: Leo is 3.5 years old and full of energy. He obsesses over certain items (read: boxes), and would chew on them and scratch them to shreds. Needless to say, letting him do that would create a mess. With this scratching post, he gets to scratch, which is a perfectly normal cat behavior, but the shreds are confined to the small area. We recommend placing the scratch post in a shallow serving platter, or a similar contraption to catch the shreds, and/or sweep regularly. We periodically rotate the triangle, so that Leo can scratch all three sides evenly, and have the triangle last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Martina & Jim Bertsch

customer_reviews.title: Happy Kitty
customer_reviews.text: I just bought the PetFusion 3-Sided Scratching Post for my VERY fussy 15 year old cat. I was amazed at how quickly she adapted to it - literally within hours. She just loves it! She scratches her nails on it, goes in and out of the vertical design and just lays around it looking like she's in kitty Heaven 😺. I have used a laser beam toy for a long time to get her moving around - now she runs in and out of wherever the beam is on the scratching post. I don't think I've ever purchases anything that has so quickly been a big success. I would highly recommend it to any cat owners!
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Terrill

customer_reviews.title: 3 sided vertical cat scratching post
customer_reviews.text: We have two kitties in our household. The kitten, at times, likes to scratch the cloth furniture. We have a corded scratching post. Also, started to use cardboard scratchers. They are great, only the cats can destroy them quickly and there is always debris on the floor or carpet. Saw this vertical 3-sided, very sturdy, vertical scratcher and decided to give it a try. It arrived today. Sprayed cat nip on it. Waiting to see what the kitties do. Wish us luck!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Scratching Board of All
customer_reviews.text: We have owned several. This is the best by far. We bought a second one and my son bought one as soon as he saw ours. Our cat loves the angle for scratching and uses it all the time. We have one outside and one inside. Both are holding up really well. She also loves to play around with it by poking through the center. So far it still looks like new, but when one side starts to wear, we can flip it and use the side now on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Robeania

customer_reviews.title: 3 months in and.....
customer_reviews.text: So I got this item thinking my cat would start scratching it, instead of scratching my coach. Little did I know he wouldn’t lol. But I’m the flip side he actually loves it. He runs through it and just likes to chill around and on it, so I guess it wasn’t that bad of a purchase. If your cat is already used to scratching carpet and your chairs, he probably won’t use this to scratch but instead just play with it lol.
customer_reviews.author: Naadir

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly as expected, but my cat enjoys it
customer_reviews.text: It took a while for my cat to give it a try, but once she understood what to do, she loved it! It's a good quality scratching post, however, I wasn't aware the entire thing is cardboard, including the frame (or some type of sturdy paper material). For $40 I expected the frame to be plastic or something more durable - the edges are already getting damaged from hardly any moving it around, and one side came with a crease already in it.
customer_reviews.author: Jayci HTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: My son got one for his cat and it quickly became the goto for the cat when sharpening its claws. Had to pick one up for my cat based on how has cat immediately adapted to it. He has had his for several months and it has been pretty durable. The cat will eventually destroy it, but it should last for at least a year, if not several. The height is just right to allow the cat do that stretching thing while they work on their claws. The cat does not really hang around it all the time, but regularly pops over for a quick pit stop. It does seem to discourage sharpening on other things...like the couch.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Tate

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it!!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this! The first moment I set it down, my "problem child" was on it, scratching away. Several times, I have seen both cats using it, one on each side. I put a little cat nip on it to let them know it was theirs, and they were all over it! I ordered 2 other Pet Fusion items recently and, between them, they have saved my new furniture because they are apparently far more fun that destroying my new chairs. Yea!!! All have been good products and seem to be holding up well, even with 2 large cats shredding on them many times a day. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: jr2012

customer_reviews.title: The evil cat loves this scratching post
customer_reviews.text: We bought the smaller version of this scratching post 2 years ago and the cat used all of it well. Bought him this one and parked it by his bed. He gets up, rips on his scratching post and leaves the couch alone. He's a big cat so the large size fits him well.
customer_reviews.author: Foxkin

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfaction with Cat Scratcher
customer_reviews.text: Like: Design Dislike: Scratching material that has fallen off in big areas on the scratcher in the three or so months I’ve had the it which I certainly I didn’t expect after the relatively short time it’s been in use. I think I paid $52 a amazon.com for the scratcher & never expected it to start falling apart so soon after purchase. I would like a replacement to give it another try because my cat really uses it as compared to the last scratcher I had which was a waste of money. Thank you for your assistance with this matter. Sincerely, Cheryl Bailey 259 South Boyle Ave #102 Los Angeles CA 90033 310-710-2945
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Best Scatching post look no further.
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these because I spent $8,000.00. on a couch and love seat. and like my other couch my cat found her favorite spot to scratch it. as soon as I got this scratching post, she went for it instead. I got another one. best thing ever, now she uses both of them not my couches. don't know what it is but they work great. in the past I tried other ones, the cheap $5.00 ones. forget it. spend the money to protect your furniture.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Love This Triangle Scratching Post
customer_reviews.text: I have a couch in my office that my two cats like to scratch. I bought this scratching post to divert them from the couch. I chose this specific model because it looked cool. My eight year old cats immediately adopted it. I have it stationed near one end of the couch and the cats prefer the scratching post to the furniture. It's a bit spendy so I hope that it is durable. I've been very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this 4 months ago and it’s still in good shape. My cat uses it a lot during the day to stretch or scratch at it. At first she didn’t pay attention to it at all, so I had to get her treats to place it in the center. Eventually started using it and now she won’t leave it alone. I’m glad I bought it for my cat she stopped scratching the carpet In the apartment. It’s so good that I’m buying another to place it next to her litter box, I forgot to mention that it doesn’t leave a mess and it’s very sturdy good for the price. Buy it you won’t regret it
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Happy Cats!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and has absolutely saved our furniture! This is actually to replace and older one we have had for around a year which has gotten pretty worn for all the use it gets. Our cats love that they can scratch vertically and play all around it. This scratcher has been so great we have bought them in a variety of different shapes. Highly recommend if you have cats! But be aware you will end up with little cardboard shavings around from all the scratching which are easy to sweep up or vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: We took a gamble but unfortunately found this large sized triangle to be a $65 piece of cardboard cra.p, that also arrived damaged because it is shipped with no protection in an oversized ama.zon box with no bubble stuffing. Nobody should be spending this much money on a piece of cardboard. The kitten didn't even like it. It is highway robbery and you can do much better, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Zenful

customer_reviews.title: Get One
customer_reviews.text: My two girls love this scratcher. I’ve bought more than one and they expect it. Once over the course of a move they were without it a bit and when I brought it back they were thrilled. You should get one! Sure, not the cheapest scratcher Out there but it’s now a staple for my cats in our house. Currently I have one at the end of the bed and they actually rely on it as a play thing to jump on or use it for their front paws while dipping down from the bed. They also use it the normal way like a normal day. Also, when they play they lay in the center and have a great time.
customer_reviews.author: AMAZONALEXA

customer_reviews.title: Best scratching post I've found
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this thing. He was a kitten when I purchased this, and he went right over and began using it. He likes to climb on it and hide in it too. I like the fact that when one side gets worn out, you can just turn it to another side. It lasts a lot longer than other cardboard scratching posts because of this feature. When this one is worn out, I will probably purchase another one.
customer_reviews.author: LollyLollyLolly

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful design, great product
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the nicest products we purchased for our two kittens. They love playing on it and its never tipped over. It is incredibly sturdy yet lightweight and they love to scratch and climb it and chase each other around, over and through it. I often stick a feather in the top and they are enthralled. It is beautifully designed and extremely well made. Nice bag of fresh catnip came with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats, and I have several of these in various shapes and sizes placed throughout my home, they last about 2 years and my cats leave my furniture alone! My cats love and adore these and get super exited when the new one come into the house. Old ones get recycled since they are cardboard, there are not enough words to express just how amazing these are, well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Classy n Sassy

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE it!!
customer_reviews.text: We replaced an old sofa (that the cats had shredded) with a nice new sectional. We were really worried about the cats starting in on the new one. I bought two of these and put one out in front of the new sectional and one behind it. They love this thing so much that they haven't given the new couch a second look! You can see in the pictures how much they claw on it. Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Charmy Medlin, Membership Services Director

customer_reviews.title: it's nice
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping my cat would go lay down in the center a bit more but not much use there. I think where this piece shines is that it has height for my cat to really stretch. what made me rate it 4 stars is that if you're adding in catnip, it's not really design in a way that makes no mess, you put even a little on and it's going to kind of just fall everywhere. the purs are deep but could use for a bit larger spacing so that the nip can easily fall into the cracks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1st one lasted 4 years!
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 cats and all but one of them love to use this scratching triangle (the last one likes using the couch) Even though towards the end of 4 years the old one was pretty well used up, they all still used it, so I knew getting a new one I would definitely get my money's worth again. Once I got the new one and put it out 3 of them were fighting over it at one point.
customer_reviews.author: ck762

customer_reviews.title: Lily Precious loves her scratching post!
customer_reviews.text: Our Lily loves this scratching post! We get her the largest size because she likes to stretch when she scratches. We were buying her a similar product before this one and we were buying them like every month! They didn’t last long at all. They were not nearly as sturdy and there was cardboard all over the carpet and floor when she used the old ones. This one lasts at least three times as long. She even likes perching on top of it sometimes. I’d recommend this for all cats that have allowed a human to live with them!
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: Cats Won't Scratch!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cats love the design & look through it as if it was a tunnel, which is a favorite with them. They will not use it to scratch however, using only the floor models. I took away the floor scratcher, they used the rug instead so had to get the their usual floor one for them. This one may stay for a while longer but likely will donate it to Humane Society. Someone will benefit from it! This is a very sturdy, well-made item and wish my cats could enjoy it properly as the ability to turn it is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. MillerTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Attractive scratcher, great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality, solid, exactly as advertised. Has a nice modern appearance, much better option than tall ugly scratchers with tacky looking outdated carpet. My four cats want nothing to do with this scratcher but this is nothing new, it’s just my cats. The unveiling of new toys or cat furniture in this house is rather underwhelming and my excitement quickly turns to buyers remorse every. single. time. But hey, I try. They loved the box though! Five starts for quality and well thought out + modern design. And hey, the box is a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Cele77

customer_reviews.title: Your cat will thank you
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this scratching “post”. It is angled so she gets a good scratch and stretch. It is big and stable so it doesn’t move or flip. It is attractive in my living room. I have several different scratching posts all over my house and this is her “go to”. I like that I can switch the sides so it doesn’t get too worn in one place. Go ahead, click the ‘buy now’ button.
customer_reviews.author: jbc0831

customer_reviews.title: Cats like it...
customer_reviews.text: I have a Russian blue and a bombay mix. They both loved this. Especially, Russian Blue likes it better, to scratch it. We also have two PetFusion Ultimate Cat Scratcher Lounge. I bought this to stop him from scratching the furniture. He still scratches them but less. The only bad thing is as they scratch this small cardboards will fall around. I keep vacuuming them.
customer_reviews.author: NA

customer_reviews.title: A Good Compact Scratcher
customer_reviews.text: It took a while for my cats to "discover" this, possibly because they have multiple other claw-popping options. Even catnip didn't speed things along, but once they noticed the three-sided scratcher, they've been enjoying it.They've gotten kind of creative with the scratcher; my girl Sydney pops her claws on it, while boys Domino and Sam like to hide behind it and "ambush" each other. Whatever. I think it's a good choice for an inexpensive scratcher that doesn't take up much floor space, but don't expect wild enthusiasm immediately. My cats may be a little jaded, though. It's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Norris

customer_reviews.title: Cat parents need this ideal scratcher!
customer_reviews.text: This item is the best cat related item I have purchased. My cats were jumping on it as we took it out of the box. I needed a good scratcher. It is perfect. Well made. Solid and not a cheapy. I got the large size since I have 2 active cats. It's appearance is so nice. Cats love it. I love it and I don't mind paying a little more for good quality. I just can't say enough about this great item. They scratch and climb. AWESOME
customer_reviews.author: DCV

customer_reviews.title: Great find
customer_reviews.text: The best scratch post I’ve ever purchased. I bought the larger size it’s perfect. And considering it’s three sided you’re basically getting three scratching pads in one which makes the $60 price tag much more doable if you think of it as 20 per side. Not sure on durability (just got it) but from how It looks built and feels I’m sure it’s going to outlast anything else I’ve ever owned
customer_reviews.author: Tom D

customer_reviews.title: Cat Scratching Post
customer_reviews.text: Good purchase. I really like the free standing shape of this cat scratcher. I purchased two of the large ones to place next to my sofas to prevent the cats from scratching the corners on them. They help but the cats still occasionally go for the furniture. It would be awesome if this company could make something similar that wraps around the corners of furniture at a right angle.
customer_reviews.author: Kathrine Manning-Gray

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $40, but an acceptable product
customer_reviews.text: It’s not worth $39.99. I just got a very comparable one from Target for $19.99 that’s shaped like a tunnel. My cats like to use both. After just two weeks of use, you can see a lot of wear and tear (shown in picture) that sadly proves to me that this product wasn’t worth $40. And it constantly gets flipped to the side, hence the lower marks on sturdiness and stability. I was hoping the high price meant durability, but it doesn’t look like it. Next replacement purchase will likely be at Target for $20.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Yoon

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it! Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about paying this much for a scratching post but it's definitely worth the money. Considering the money it cost me to go to the vet to ask "why does my cat keep peeing on things randomly?" Her old scratching posts included. Turns out my cat is just a jerk and due to the shape of this one she can't pee on it. But in all seriousness, we have had this for a couple of months now and she can climb/scratch all over it and it is definitely holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey C

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and a little surprise!
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loves using this. At first she was hesitant... didn't know what to do but when i showed her how to use it, she started using it and moved it. This cat scratcher came with a tiny bag of catnip which btw is amazing!! My cat who never liked catnip and never reacted to it, LOVED this one! It is all natural and straight "from the field" ;) . Thank you so much for this, now I know how I can make this little princess happier! ❤
customer_reviews.author: Romila Lal

customer_reviews.title: Worse than useless for our cats
customer_reviews.text: Tried this to provide some variety to simple scratch boxes. When our cats try to scratch on this post it falls over and moves all around the floor. In the process it spreads litter, cardboard, and cat nip all over the floors. Small stick on dots provided did nothing to stabilize this device. One of our cats is really small and even she can't use it. Worse than useless in that it messes up the floors with litter and cardboard when they use it. Tried it for a week then put it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is your cat a vertical scratcher? This one's for you!
customer_reviews.text: I've had horizontal card board scratchers that my relatively new cat would have very little to do with it. She mostly bites off the cardboard around it and spits it out. This scratcher she loves. She's able to get a long stretch out of it which she just loves. It's also pretty sturdy and has been lasting a long time. I'm going to buy a second one for the upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M. Cipriani

customer_reviews.title: Best Scratcher ever!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so much better than i thought it was going to be. it is very sturdy and the regular size is perfect for my cat. She loves to scratch door frames so being able to scratch vertically on this makes her happy. She has been using it frequently since it arrived. I will be buying another one in the distant future when this one wears out!
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: One big cat likes it for scratching. Cats do ...
customer_reviews.text: One big cat likes it for scratching. Cats do not scratch inside of triagle, One cat prefers to eat the shreds of cardboard and eat treats out of it. Well made. Main issue is that unlike cardboard scratchers that come inside a little box where the clawed-off bits fall inside the little box, the cardboard bits have to be swept up.
customer_reviews.author: GristMill

customer_reviews.title: 2 Cats in Love
customer_reviews.text: This was packaged well. It’s very sturdy. My 2 cats love this thing. I keep moving it and rotating it around to see if they prefer it in one location vs another. It doesn’t matter where I place it, they use it. I have a love/hate relationship with it. I love that my cats like it and use it daily. I hate that I have to vacuum up cardboard pieces every day. I am wondering how long it will last before it needs to be replaced. If I remember I’ll update this review when I do.
customer_reviews.author: Lizard

customer_reviews.title: Great Scratching Post!
customer_reviews.text: It took a day or two for our two cats to decide to try this out, but once they did they seemed to really like using it. I like that it doesn't seem to "shed" cardboard bits like some of the other ones do. It's not bad looking, either, if you have to have one in your living room. I keep this one tucked out of sight in a corner near a very "vulnerable" chair, and they have left the chair alone since they started using this product. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazongal

customer_reviews.title: ... has never used a scratching post (I had a nice big one) just our furniture
customer_reviews.text: My cat has never used a scratching post (I had a nice big one) just our furniture. She loves this to play on, but hasn't started really scratching it up yet, but close. She has only had it for a week and we play on and inside it every day multiple times. I'm really glad I got it for her. I put it by the couch where she likes to scratch to give her a better option. I repurchased this items recently. This has proven to a great scratcher for my cats. I still have my old one because my kitty is attached to it still. I guess it's her toy... I would recommend. I did buy again!
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Hale

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for kittens !!
customer_reviews.text: Little kittens LOVE it! They climb it, play hide and seek in and around it, etc. A wonderful piece.
customer_reviews.author: P. N. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: A cat scratchier that my cat loves and that isn't ugly!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this! He scratches it, rubs against it, and even just likes to hang out in it. He hardly scratches on things he's not supposed to now. He tore up the first one I bought for him (took about a year of using it every day) so I got him a new one!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Morris

customer_reviews.title: A good size and STURDY
customer_reviews.text: My fur-baby is an 18 lb-ish main coon and he loves this scratcher! it is much sturdier than the normal triangle shape ones and does not move around when scratching it--we have it on our rug in the living room. He loves sleeping with his body stretched out inside it--of course he's a big boy and he doesn't fit all the way inside but he loves to hide in it thinking if he can't see us, we can't see him. anyway, it was a little pricier than most but it is an excellent product. due to its sturdiness, it might hold up longer than the others as he definitely scratches it into a frenzy!
customer_reviews.author: j thomas

customer_reviews.title: Really an excellent quality scratcher
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my kitten, and it's been 100% a hit. He took to it right away, and uses it regularly. We also have the larger wavy lounger, and he likes that too, though he uses that more for play and sleeping and the 3-sided one for active scratching. Got the smaller size for him, as he's still fairly little. Will buy the larger when he's grown to provide for his longer reach. Really an excellent quality scratcher, and it looks nice in the house as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn MTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if he'd want to use it or not, but it's his favorite thing ever. He gets inside and scratches, and then just naps there. He scratches the outside. I put his toys on top and he knocks them off and scratches. I rub cat nip in it and he goes cuh-razy. And it looks fine in your living room. I keep rotating the sides so he has fresh area, but it will last a long long time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shortridge

customer_reviews.title: Wow, this really works!
customer_reviews.text: Our cats have always gone after our couches, chairs, and rugs, despite the many different types of scratching posts we have. After recently buying some new furniture I thought I’d try this as a last ditch effort and wow, it really works! The second I took it out of the box they went right over and started scratching and rolling around. They have not touched the furniture since (...knock on wood...). I bought the large so they can really stretch out and fit through the middle as well. So happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: LA82

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for almost 6 months now and it's still got life. I like that it has three sides so I can rotate it when on is worn. I rescued 2 cats and they weren't sure of what to make of it. I sprayed liquid catnip on it and that helped them recognize that they could scratch on it. I will definitely buy another one when this one is done!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki J. Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes it.....but doesnt seem durable
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mom's cat, and they seem to like it. However, I didnt realize it was made of a cardboard type material. I doubt this is durable and will probably be destroyed in a couple of months. For this price, I am not sure this is worth it. I debating returning it, but the one cat already damaged it.
customer_reviews.author: Holly1621

customer_reviews.title: My long cat approved and loves me more.. I think
customer_reviews.text: This thing is excellent. I was hesitant because of the price for cardboard but it is holding up to my giant cat attacking and using it. It is much better than the flimsy cardboard floor “ramps”we have had before that leaves a large mess. There is no mess with this so far there is good resistance to the scratching. It is tall enough my cat doesn’t want to scratch the table chairs or couch.
customer_reviews.author: TigerLily

customer_reviews.title: Yes! I’ll be ordering two more of these
customer_reviews.text: It’s the best scenario I could’ve hoped for! As soon as I unboxed the product and walked away my female cat went into the center and started crying away. I’m going to order more of these. And because it’s a triangle and stable on all ends, if they tear up the bottom section all I do is rotate at 90°
customer_reviews.author: Amy M. Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfactory!
customer_reviews.text: I have used other scratching pads/posts in the past, but this is, by far, the least satisfactory! When my cat uses it, pieces of the surface are loosened and fall all over the floor, requiring constant clean-up. I cannot recommend this to anyone. Other reviewers seem pleased with the product, so perhaps I received a reject?
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Constructed
customer_reviews.text: My cats have no interest in this scratcher post. Additionally, it is poorly constructed and cheap, as the siding is pealing away, considering my cats don’t even use it. I have had this for three months and it should last longer than three months. You can clearly see it has not been used and it’s already falling apart. Complete waste of money!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Gaughan

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably good scratching post
customer_reviews.text: Have never had cats who were not declawed (front paws) —several cats in the past.2 new kitties etly and were encouragd by the shelter to give them a chance with scratching post.Came across this on amazon search and boy did we hit the jackpot. Little sprinkle of catnip on it and lots of verbal praise when they use it. My furniture is now safe. They love it and I am most impressed. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: earl

customer_reviews.title: My kitten *update* now a cat  loves this triangle
customer_reviews.text: From day one my 10 week kitten used it. She loves to run up it and through it n scratches on it daily. Made of good quality does not fray, will last and last. So glad I bought this triangle scratching post. *update* It's almost 1year that I have this scratcher and I am buying another one. The original started to fray but my cat really likes it and I like the modern look. I thought it would last longer but my cat does use it a couple times a day. I have a scratcher in just about every room but this one gets used most. I'm happy enough with it to buy a new one
customer_reviews.author: francine13

customer_reviews.title: Cats love this! They love all PetFusion scratchers
customer_reviews.text: Cats love this! They love all PetFusion scratchers. Plus they are kind of stylish and don't look utilitarian. They do however leave a huge mess of cardboard on the floor. Not a big deal, I just clean it up every day or so but it is messy. I have several PetFusion cat products: Cat loungers (I have, well...my cats have 6 of them), cat trees and the triangular cat scratchers along with another cat lounges (all PetFusion). All superior products...BUT they leave cardboard bits when the cats scratch.
customer_reviews.author: betsy

customer_reviews.title: Great scratcher if you're tight on space!
customer_reviews.text: Great scratcher for the cat and great for play too since the cat can go through it, over it, and you can slide things under it. Our cat loves to stretch it's back while clawing on it too. Only downside is cardboard-like particles come out after a few months, the more used and scratched it gets. Nothing that a quick vacuum can't take care of though. Great scratcher if you're tight on space!
customer_reviews.author: FisL

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Our kitten absolutely loves this. My favorite part is the size. We don’t have a ton of space in the house we currently rent so I was specifically looking for something reasonably sized that’s not gigantic. It comes with catnip in case you need to entice your cat to use it, which is nice but Genevieve didn’t need that to be interested in using. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Tingquist

customer_reviews.title: Great for Stretching Scratchers!!
customer_reviews.text: Yes!! It works.My cat sooooo picky. she would not use anything I bought. she loved my chairs too much. After two days and laying treats on this she's loving it!! Thanks!!!!! I think it's the stretch she gets. Whatever the reason I am happy. It will arrive in a huge box and its very heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Veggie Sistah

customer_reviews.title: Apparently not all cats love this design.....so think twice before sinking money into this one.
customer_reviews.text: My cats totally ignore this item...sprayed it with catnip spray, sprinkled the catnip pack it came with on it...nothing. It is now just sitting there ignored.... :( Not much else I can do with it...I am hoping someday it will spark some interest but so far barely a sniff from 4 cats!
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES this and has stopped tearing at my sofa. Have bought two more of these and will keep buying them for her! The first one is torn apart but she still keeps going back to use it. I’m delighted with this product. You can turn it over to expose a new side for her to claw-away to her hearts content. Just sprinkle with a little catnip and watch your cat go to work.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Martin

customer_reviews.title: OK but environmenatally unfriendly
customer_reviews.text: My cats sort of like it, but they don't love it. I don't love it because it's non-recyclable and non-reusable once the cardboard scratchers are all used up. It would be better if there were a way to re-use the hard plastic shell by being able to buy replacement cardboard inserts. And the hard plastic will one day end up in a land-fill.....
customer_reviews.author: JPB

customer_reviews.title: Super Stable, Doesn't Fall Apart
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in this GINORMOUS Amazon box, I was afraid: I live in a small city apartment - where would I put this thing? Upon opening it, its the perfect shape and height. Like Goldilocks, it's not too big, not too small, just right! It's stashed in the corner of my room and my cat loves it. She goes to town scratching it and no shredded pieces to pick up, heavy enough it doesn't budge or slide around. No sign of wearing out anytime soon!
customer_reviews.author: Ronan11

customer_reviews.title: cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: my car loved this item. It is very well made and worth every penny. He loves going iin it and hiding. There are all three sides good for scratching. He can even use the inside. High quality . He uses this rather then furniture. Keeps kitty happy. I really recommend this item to please your cat.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Usul Approved!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I could barely get this out of the box and unwrapped before the kittens decided this was their new favorite scratching post. I have to admit, I was skeptical due tot the price. I bought the large scratching post, but you get what you pay for! This is great! It’s a new piece of kitty approved furniture. This post looks nice and seems very durable! Usul approves 100%
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: I'm sure it's a great product but not for my cat
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure it's a great product but not for my cat. He really didn't care for it at all even when I tried putting catnip on it. I just ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly B.

customer_reviews.title: Our Buddy loves it
customer_reviews.text: Our Buddy is a feral turned housecat so He can be very rough on play items. Buddy loves the this thing He hides in it and knocks it all over As far as lasting long I doubt if the sides will last long at all. I'm happy with it because Buddy likes it and if Buddy's happy the rest of the family is happy.
customer_reviews.author: tom lasko

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for your Burly Terror
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a huge thug and loves nothing more than tearing stuff up. She LOVES this scratching post so much that she is no longer interested in ruining my furniture. She's almost 20 lbs of muscle and attacks The Triangle with great enthusiasm. Holds up great against her drive-by attacks. Only one drawback: This item is non-recyclable and non-reusable once the cardboard scratchers are used up. She's pretty much laid to waste two of the sides in less than a month. Saving the final side as long as I can. This product may prove monetarily and environmentally expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.
